If it was ![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol): gain 1 life, it would be to good. At ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol),![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol): Gain 1 life, it is too underpowered. posts.post_content: Oh man, I have some memories of this thing. Back when I started playing (around Time Spiral, I think), my playgroup was... bad, to say the least. [Suntail Hawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Suntail Hawk) was pretty much an instant win, and [Deep-Sea Kraken](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deep-Sea Kraken) was unthinkably strong. This card was one of the best cards to have... other failures include not knowing what trample did, thinking [Hex](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hex) could target less than 6 creatures, thinking "Add {1} to your mana pool" was the same as "add one mana of any color to your mana pool," and thinking that [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) fetched three swamps. I'm glad we all started getting competent by the time we got to high school.
posts.html:

I'm glad we all started getting competent by the time we got to high school.
